title: Marketing Data Science Intern
description:
Description
Marketing Data Science Intern
Marketing, Communications and Growth
50 Amica Way, Lincoln RI 02865 

Thank you for considering Amica as part of your career journey, where your future is our business.

At Amica, we pride ourselves on being an inclusive and supportive environment. We all work together to accomplish the common goal of providing the best experience for our customers. We believe in trust and fostering lasting relationships for our customers and employees! We’re focused on creating a workplace that works for all. We’ll continue to provide training, guidance, and resources to make Amica a true place of belonging for all employees. Want to learn more about our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion? Visit our DEI page to read about it!

As a mutual company, our people are our priority. We seek differences of opinion, life experience and perspective to represent the diversity of our policyholders and achieve the best possible outcomes. Our office located in Lincoln, RI is seeking a Marketing Data Science Intern to join the team for Summer 2026! This internship offers an opportunity to gain hands‑on experience with advanced analytics tools, to learn applications of statistical and machine learning methods, and to experience how a best-in-class marketing team engages its key audiences.

This position is a 37.5-hour work week Monday through Friday during the summer months. Work from home may be available two days a week once trained to work independently. 

About the Program 

Amica offers a top-rate internship program that provides valuable experience and a cross functional, collaborative team environment. We strive to provide students with a multitude of opportunities in their chosen field of study, while fostering connections and experiences throughout various departments. In keeping with our renowned company culture, our internship program also involves various team building exercises and company-wide events to celebrate all the reasons that make Amica one of the best places to work! 

Responsibilities:
• Assist in researching and implementing analytical and statistical methods to solve marketing‑related business problems.
• Contribute to project execution by preparing datasets, running analyses, and summarizing results.
• Help design, build, and evaluate predictive models across areas such as response, conversion, premium, risk, and customer value.
• Support the test‑and‑learn process by designing, tracking, and analyzing A/B tests and other experiments.
• Analyze media performance results by developing and delivering reports and dashboards that support strategic decision-making.

Qualifications:
• Rising junior or senior working toward a bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Business Analytics or Computer Science.
• Strong interest in marketing analytics, experimentation, and predictive modeling.
• Curiosity and strong drive to learn new technologies and challenge assumptions.
• Foundational experience with statistical inference and machine learning techniques through coursework or projects.
• Experience with SQL and common Python data science packages.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to document and communicate work processes to others.

Amica conducts background checks which includes a review of criminal, educational, employment and social media histories, and if the role involves use of a company vehicle, a motor vehicle or driving history report. The background check will not be initiated until after a conditional offer of employment is made and the candidate accepts the offer. Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment.

The safety and security of our employees and our customers is a top priority. Employees may have access to employees’ and customers’ personal and financial information in order to perform their job duties. Candidates with a criminal history that imposes a direct or indirect threat to our employees’ or customers’ physical, mental or financial well-being may result in the withdrawal of the conditional offer of employment.

About Amica

Amica Mutual Insurance Company is America’s oldest mutual insurer of automobiles. A direct national writer, Amica also offers home, marine and umbrella insurance. Amica Life Insurance Company, a wholly owned subsidiary, provides life insurance and retirement solutions. Amica was founded on the principles of creating peace of mind and building enduring relationships for and with our exceptionally loyal policyholders, a mission that thousands of employees in offices nationwide share and support. 

Equal Opportunity Policy: All qualified applicants who are authorized to work in the United States will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, family status, ethnicity, age, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, mental condition, military status, genetic information or any other class protected by law. The Age Discrimination in Employment Act prohibits discrimination on the basis of age with respect to individuals who are 40 years of age or older. Employees are subject to the provisions of the Workers' Compensation Act.

Amica Mutual Insurance Company is committed to protecting job seekers from recruitment fraud. We never request sensitive personal information or payment during the interview process. All legitimate job opportunities are listed on our official careers site: https://careers.amica.com. Learn more in the "Is Amica hiring?" section of our FAQ

title: Data Scientist Intern
description:
Avathon is revolutionizing industrial AI with a powerful platform that enables businesses to harness the full potential of their operational data. As a Data Science Intern, you will analyze complex datasets and develop machine learning models to drive key business decisions in renewable energy, supply chain, and industrial operations.

Responsibilities
• Analyze complex datasets to extract actionable insights for renewable energy, supply chain, and industrial applications
• Develop and apply machine learning models to solve real business challenges
• Apply data mining techniques, statistical analysis, and help build prediction systems
• Assist in feature selection, data preprocessing, and model optimization
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design data-driven solutions
• Create automated anomaly detection systems and track performance metrics
• Present findings and results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
• Contribute to product development by implementing algorithms in our platform

Skills
• Currently enrolled or recently graduated with a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or a related field
• Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R
• A solid understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms (regression, classification, clustering)
• Experience with data manipulation libraries (Pandas, NumPy)
• Familiarity with data visualization tools (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly)
• Strong problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• A can-do attitude and desire to make a difference
• Familiarity with Deep Learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch
• Experience with time series analysis and forecasting
• Knowledge of industrial systems or IoT time series data
• Interest in or exposure to AI agents and agentic workflows
• Familiarity with RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) concepts and LLM applications
• Exposure to cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
• Experience with SQL or Graph databases
• Portfolio of projects demonstrating data science skills (GitHub, Kaggle, etc.)
• Ability to stay for an extended co-op or full-time opportunity after internship

Company Overview
• Avathon is an AI technology startup operating a machine learning software to analyze increasingly complex data stores. It was founded in 2013, and is headquartered in Pleasanton, California, USA, with a workforce of 201-500 employees. Its website is https://avathon.com.

Company H1B Sponsorship
• Avathon has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships, with 5 in 2025. Please note that this does not guarantee sponsorship for this specific role.
